intro: Turraea tetramera, commonly known as the four-angled turraea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
